intro.description: This tutorial helps you create a cross-tab inside a BIRT report

item.title: Build a Data Source
item.description:
In Data Explorer, right-click Data Sources and choose New Data Source.
- On New Data Source, Classic Models Inc. Sample Database is selected. Choose Next.
- Choose Finish.

item.title: Build a Data Set
item.description:
- In Data Explorer, right-click Data Sets and choose New Data Set.
- On New Data Set, choose Next.
- On Query, in Available Items, expand one or more tables in the ClassicModels database.
- To create a SQL query, drag column names from Available Items to the right pane to write the SELECT and FROM clauses. Then, choose Finish.
- On Edit Data Set, select Preview Results. Then, choose OK.

item.title: Set up data for the cross tab
item.description:
- In Data Explorer, right-click Data Cubes and choose New Data Cube.
- In Data Set Selection, in Primary Data set, select the data set that you just created. Then, choose Groups and Summaries.
- In Groups and Summaries, drag fields to create Groups (Dimensions) and Summary Fields (Measures).
- Choose OK.

item.title: Add a cross tab to the report
item.description:
- In the layout editor, double-click the template cross-tab element to enable editing.
- Drag group fields from the data cube into row and column cells in the cross tab.
- Drag summary fields from the data cube into the fields to be summarized cell in the cross tab.

item.title: Add grand totals
item.description: In the layout editor, select the cross tab. In the property editor, add totals to the Row Area and Column Area in Sub Totals and Grand Totals.
